joehung302 wrote:
> 
>  >
>  > Did you pass order file to JMX addJob or a jar of order + seeds +
>  > overrides, etc?  If the latter, it will make a new job *based* on
> the
>  > content of the jar. Then you should see new directory under job
> dir). 
>  > If former, then I believe, it will just use order values as are on
>  > resumption (Is the resumed crawl running out of the checkpoint
> directory
>  > or out of the original job directory?).
> 
> I was doing the former. seems like a bad choice...
> 
> Assuming I don't have any overrides, can I just pass it a jar file
> containing both order.xml and seeds.txt?

Yes.

> 
> Also, I have no idea how to supply the 4th parameter (seeds) for
> addJob. I'm just passing "x" for now because I thought it would pick
> it up from the jar file if I do the jar file thingy. Or should I
> specify something else?
>

Others here that make use of it pass the empty string (Need to add an 
override that is absent the seeds parameter).

Keep asking questions,
St.Ack



> Cheers,
> -joe
